body: ~~Will add a repro test case, the example I tried passed (unexpectedly)~~ âœ…

repository.name: jest-dom
repository.description: :owl: Custom jest matchers to test the state of the DOM

body: Is this happening only with the string `"0"`? Because from the code I think any string will match `.toHaveTextContent('')`. This is all ultimately determined [here](https://github.com/testing-library/jest-dom/blob/b2b4bd3ba65c48b350194a7623797e70f8a1390e/src/utils.js#L119), and any string `.includes('')`.
Ah, indeed, it fails to throw for other strings.

rename.from: toHaveTextContent("") matches element with "0" as textContent
rename.to: toHaveTextContent("") matches element with non-empty content

body: I don't think it should use `includes` here - use a regex for partial matches, or provide something like `toContainText` which is explicitly partial

issue.title: Fix .toHaveTextContent("")  causing false positive

repository.name: jest-dom
repository.description: :owl: Custom jest matchers to test the state of the DOM

video course helpful: http://kcd.im/pull-request

Please fill out the information below to expedite the review and (hopefully)
merge of your pull request!
-->

**What**:

fix #104 

**Why**:

It can cause false-positive tests passing

**How**:

throwing when matching against an empty string, suggesting to use `.toBeEmpty()` instead

issue.body:
Snyk has created this PR to upgrade `@testing-library/jest-dom` from 4.1.0 to 4.1.2. - The recommended version is **2 versions** ahead of your current version. - The recommended version was released **9 days ago**, on 2019-10-09.
Release notes
  • 4.1.2 - 2019-10-09

    4.1.2 (2019-10-09)

    Bug Fixes

    • toHaveStyle not to return true when shouldn't (#81) (d048768)
  • 4.1.1 - 2019-10-07

    4.1.1 (2019-10-07)

    Bug Fixes

    • toHaveTextContent("") causing false positive (#138) (cdc8a06), closes #104
  • 4.1.0 - 2019-08-21

    4.1.0 (2019-08-21)

    Features

    • toBeValid supports element (#127) (567d3ad)
